vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
πλᾰτύν-ω,
(πλατύς) widen, τὰ φυλακτήρια [NT+1st c.AD+]; π. τὸ στῖφος widen it out,[Refs 1st c.BC+] —middle, τὴν γῆν πλατύνεσθαι widen one's territory, [Refs 5th c.BC+]:—passive, grow broad, widen out, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; of the pupils, to be dilated, [Refs 1st c.AD+]is opened, relieved from care, [LXX+NT]
__2 ἐπλατύνθη.. τὸ στόμα μου was opened wide,[LXX] be puffed up,[LXX]:—middle, talk big of oneself, τί πλατύνεαι, ἠλίθιος ὥ; [Refs]
__3 pronounce broadly, τὴν φωνήν [Refs 1st c.AD+]
__4 amplify, τὸν λόγον [Refs 1st c.BC+]:—passive, διήγησις πλατύνεται τρόποις [Refs]: absolutely, use amplification, [Refs 1st c.BC+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: to open wide, make wide widen
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
to open wide, make wide widen
to make broad, widen, enlarge, Mt. 23:5; passive metaphorically of the heart, from the Hebrew, to be expanded with kindly and genial feelings, 2Cor. 6:11, 13*
